question: 添える
userAnswer:
to{} garnish/supplement | add-as-support/attach/include | accompany | <tag>arch:</tag> mimic/imitate | draw-near
to-be-able-to:　meet/satisfy/comply-with | accompany/{go/stay}-with | {associate/mix}-with | marry
activeAnswer:
to{} garnish/supplement | add-as-support/attach/include | accompany | <tag>arch:</tag> mimic/imitate | draw-near
to-be-able-to:　meet/satisfy/comply-with | accompany/{go/stay}-with | {associate/mix}-with | marry
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>append</kanji>, so the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to append</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: <vocabulary>To append</vocabulary> something to something else, you can just <reading>sew</reading> (<ja>そ</ja>) it onto something else.
